title: Amherst-Plymouth Wildlife Management Area
text:
Amherst-Plymouth Wildlife Management Area is a <a href="protected%20area">protected area</a> located in <a href="Putnam%20County%2C%20West%20Virginia">Putnam County, West Virginia</a>. The site is along the banks of the <a href="Kanawha%20River">Kanawha River</a> and is popular for hunting <a href="Canada%20geese">Canada geese</a> in the fall. Access is from <a href="West%20Virginia%20Route%2062">West Virginia Route 62</a> between <a href="Bancroft%2C%20West%20Virginia">Bancroft</a> and <a href="Hometown%2C%20West%20Virginia">Hometown</a> and from Manilla Creek Road and Heizer Creek Road off WV 62 north of <a href="Poca%2C%20West%20Virginia">Poca, West Virginia</a>. Manilla Creek Road cuts across the north side of the Amherst-Plymouth WMA, and WV 62 follows the southern edge of the area alongside the Kanawha River.
Hunting and fishing.
<a href="Hunting">Hunting</a> opportunities include <a href="White-tailed%20deer">deer</a>, <a href="grouse">grouse</a>, <a href="rabbit">rabbit</a>, <a href="raccoon">raccoon</a>, <a href="squirrel">squirrel</a>, and <a href="Wild%20turkey">turkey</a>. <a href="Fishing">Fishing</a> opportunities from the banks of the Guano Creek <a href="Backwater%20%28river%29">backwater</a> and the <a href="Kanawha%20River">Kanawha River</a> include <a href="Striped%20bass">hybrid-striped bass</a>, <a href="white%20bass">white bass</a>, <a href="carp">carp</a>, <a href="Channel%20catfish">channel</a> and <a href="flathead%20catfish">flathead catfish</a>, <a href="Sciaenidae">freshwater drum</a>, <a href="sauger">sauger</a>.
